description.narrative:
Context: This project is a human rights projects that challenges discrimination, violence and injustice on the grounds of sexual orientation and/or gender identity and the power imbalances which prevent LGBTI persons from enjoying their rights in Laos. Article 35of the Constitution of Laos states that #Lao citizens are all equal before the law irrespective of their gender, social status, education, beliefs and ethnicity#. However, this does not translate into practice for LGBTI people, as Laos does notgenerally officially recognize the term itself and officials even claim that there are no LGBTI persons in Laos. In practice LGBTI people in Laos face a large extent of stigmatisation and discrimination.
Goal: The goal of the project therefore is to to help build a nascent culture of respect for fundamental rights of the LGBTI community in Laos. This requires an enabling environment of policies and attitudes that support and protect LGBTI people to claim their rights, and safe spaces to express theirviews.
Objective: In practice, the project shall support and strengthen the capacity of partner Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) Lao Positive Health Association (LaoPHA) and PTBUL working as leaders on the promotion of human rights of LGBTI. This is by building their capacities to produce workplace and policy studies, advocacy and awareness, and community mobilization on the issue, which will be through:
1. Training local partners to conduct critical research on workplace, community and family perceptions around LGBTI persons, conduct studies and develop concrete recommendations on employment inclusiveness of LGBTI persons. 2. Network-building amongst civil society organisations around gender diversity issues 3. Developing a shared vision and roadmap for LGBTI rights in Laos 4. Organize multi-stakeholder events to raise awareness of and promote the International Day Against Homophobia, Biphobia and Transphobia 5. Work with companies and organisations to understand anti-discrimination policies and best practices and to revisit their own practices and policies 6. Empower the LaoLGBTI civil society through exposure visits to Cambodian and Vietnamese LGBTI communities to learn about advocacy and awareness raising tools and gain practical skills

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam in Laos is registered under the legal personality of Oxfam in Belgium and is national country office for Oxfam international.Oxfam in Laos PDR is responsible for the implementation of the Sowing Diversity Harvesting = Security program in close coordinationwith national organizations including the National Agriculture and Forestry Research Institute (NAFRI), the Department of Agriculture (DOA), Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MAF) and Lao Farmers Network (LFN). Oxfam Belgium is one of 17 Affiliates that are part of the Oxfam Confederation. As part of this confederation, Oxfam Belgium shared the common vision of a just world without poverty. A world where people are valued and treated equally, enjoy their rightsas full citizens, and can influence decisions affecting their lives.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
